title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Wednesday 15 November 2017 - BBC News
summary: pensioner 's terrified 999 call after armed robbery released .
council pledges more than £ 100k to help the homeless .
nottingham 's ice bar is back and it 's twice the size .
derby to get own walk of fame .

documents.title: cricketer guilty of exposing himself
text: cricketer guilty of exposing himself

documents.title: stranger 's appeal nets homeless man job
text: stranger 's appeal nets homeless man job

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: regular live coverage on this page has ended for the day , but breaking news , sport and travel updates will continue to appear through the night .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 thursday morning .

documents.title: mp reports tweets after brexit mutineers front page
text: at least five threatening tweets have been reported to the police by broxtowe mp anna soubry .

she said it came after a number of pro-european conservatives , including rushcliffe 's ken clarke , were branded `` mutineers '' in the daily telegraph this morning and `` collaborators '' in the daily mail .
ms soubry said the move amounts to `` bullying '' and told the house of commons the matter had been referred to the police .
prime minister theresa may says she hopes that parliament can `` come together '' over brexit and is insisting that she 's `` listening carefully '' to the government 's critics .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cloudy night with mist and fog
text: it will be a cloudy night with some mist or fog developing and a few spots of drizzle possible by dawn .
early fog patches will soon clear to brighter spells tomorrow morning but it will be cloudy with outbreaks of rain moving in from the northwest by midday .
this rain and cloud will clear to the southeast during the afternoon with sunny skies following on behind with a maximum temperatures of 11 deg c ( 52f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: family deck out their property with thousands of lights
text: these christmas decorations have become a bit of a family tradition at one home in nuthall .
the swifts used hundreds of lights and baubles to decorate their home in nuthall and this weekend will officially turn them on , ably assisted by the siddiqui family , off channel 4 's gogglebox .
thousands of people have visited their property over the years , raising more than £ 80,000 to date for charities .
this year they are fundraising for hayward house , the palliative care unit at nottingham city hospital and when you wish upon a star .
here 's hoping this year is as successful as last ,
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: peter shilton : 'jack butland should be england goalkeeper '
text: england 's most capped player peter shilton has told the bbc that stoke 's jack butland should be first choice goalkeeper for his country .
butland ( missed the recent goalless draws with germany and brazil with a broken finger .
jordan pickford and joe hart each played in his absence .
shilton played 125 games as keeper for england and made 1,249 appearances for clubs including leicester city , derby county and nottingham forest .
author: BBC Derby Sport

documents.title: girl 'left to die as men rang escorts '
text: girl 'left to die as men rang escorts '

documents.title: crash closes lane on a42
text: worth knowing if you 're about to hit the road near ashby-de-la-zouch .
# leicestershire # a42 we have 1 lane closed due to a collision southbound between j12 ( # willesley ) and j11 ( # m42 ) .
# trafficofficers en route to assist .
approach scene with caution .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pedestrian hit by van in woodville
text: a pedestrian has been hit by a van on high street in woodville .
the road is now closed .
police have said the man on foot suffered `` serious injuries '' and has been airlifted to hospital in nottingham .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mugger tackled by have-a-go hero
text: mugger tackled by have-a-go hero

documents.title: officers praise man who caught violent robber
text: police have praised a man who single-handedly apprehended a violent robber .
claudio rosu , 24 , ( carried out a series of attacks in beeston in september , the court has heard .
the romanian national was eventually tackled by local man nick martin on beeston high road , two days after he had seen a cctv appeal for rosu .
nick ( below ) said : `` i look over at the doors of sun valley amusements and he just came walking out of the doors and i instantly recognised him .
`` i sprinted after him just down the road and got him in a choke hold .

he was wriggling to get through , he was biting , scratching , spitting but he managed to get into his wallet and he was pulling out money and saying 'i 'm sorry ' i think he was thinking he was getting some sort of karma . ''
rosu was today jailed for four years after pleading guilty to robbery , assault and theft at nottingham crown court .
the judge expects him to be deported as soon as his sentence is finished .
author: Giles Taylor
BBC East Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: your comments : donating umbilical cord blood
text: some of you have been in touch on facebook to share your stories of donating umbilical cord blood .
it 's after the anthony nolan charity made an appeal for more new mums to register to donate theirs after giving birth .
jess burton said she donated the cord from her twin girls born in june - they have matching vests to prove it .
so did cher williamson when little matilda was born in august .
charlotte ryan said : `` i donated four years ago and they found a match and my sons cord saved a life .
it 's not until recently in july when i gave birth the ladies from antony nolan told me that not everyone 's cord actually matches and she cried when i told her tyler 's did .
as it 's very rare .
nice knowing you saved a life . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: money stolen during robbery at convenience store
text: cash has been stolen during a robbery at a shop in bestwood .
nottinghamshire police said a man went into bargain booze in beckhampton road and demanded money from the till .
it is thought he then ran towards pedmore valley at about 22:00 yesterday .
officers said the suspect was white , in his 20s and was wearing dark clothing .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man 'critical ' after chaddesden stabbing
text: police have arrested a 19-year-old man in connection with an assault on a man in chaddesden last night .
they 've said the victim was found on race course park after being stabbed .
he remains in a `` critical condition '' in hospital in nottingham .
investigations into the assault are continuing .
police believe another person was involved .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new strike action over special schools pay
text: unison members at derby 's special schools have voted to take new strike action over the city council 's pay review .
the industrial action had stopped earlier this year with the two sides in the dispute appearing to have come to a deal .
unison has accused the council of going back on its promises , but the council says it did what it said it would .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: antique christmas tree to be auctioned for charity
text: this is one of britain 's first ever artificial christmas trees .
it was brought by diana rigby 's parents in the 1930s and is thought to have come from woolworths at a cost of just sixpence .
mrs rigby said the 3ft 6ins christmas tree used to take pride of place her family home when she was growing up .
she said : `` it used to come out every christmas and it was the main family tree .

i do n't remember much about those days , or how it was decorated , but my mother told me i once thrashed the tree around when i was very little because i was angry that she 'd put the baubles on without me . ''
mrs rigby , from derby , has decided to sell the tree at auction to raise money for children 's cancer research .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: badger rescued from sewage tank
text: how many people does it take to free a badger from a giant tank ?
quite a lot apparently .
the fire service received a call from the rspca requesting assistance to release the animal trapped inside a tank used for processing sewage in whetstone .
thankfully , it was n't full at the time .
they then had to wait for a vet to arrive to sedate the animal but once it had been tranquillised two firemen managed to go inside and retrieve the badger .
at least there was a happy ending after all that .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: megan bannister : schoolgirl 'left to die on backseat '
text: a leicestershire schoolgirl was left to die on the backseat of a car , a court has heard .
jason burder and adam king have gone on trial at birmingham crown court following the death of 16-year-old megan bannister .
miranda moore , prosecuting , said the defendants drove the girl around while ringing escorts and stopping to buy beer .
megan was found half-covered by a coat , lying in the back of a car that had been involved in a crash near enderby on sunday 14 may .
mr burder and mr king , both 28 , are accused of her manslaughter by gross negligence by supplying her with mdma , strangling her and then neglecting her life-threatening condition .
blood tests revealed she had `` 10 times the amount of mdma '' in her system than either of the two men .
mr burder , of braunstone avenue , and mr king , of waltham avenue , leicester , deny wrongdoing and the trial continues .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new unemployment figures for area
text: new figures show unemployment rose in the east midlands by 1,000 in the three months to september .
94,000 people are out of work in the region .
that 's a rate of 4 % .
in lincolnshire just over 7,000 people claimed out of work benefits last month .
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: notts county make colin slater honorary vice-president
text: colin slater , bbc radio nottingham 's former notts county reporter , has been named as an honorary vice president of the league two club .
the 83-year-old retired at the end of the 2016-17 season having covered more than 2,500 notts matches .
slater , who was made an mbe in 2001 , said : `` it 's difficult to express how honoured i feel .
`` it 's something i never thought would happen in my wildest dreams . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: alleged bomb plotter was 'trying to get a fake passport '
text: a derby man has been telling a terrorism trial why he sent messages to a commander from the so-called islamic state .
munir mohammed said he was only trying to get a fake passport and did n't know the man from is until he talked about organising an attack .
mr mohammed and chemist rowaida el hassan , from london , both denied trying to make a bomb or ricin poison .
the trial continues .
author: Jeremy Ball
Social affairs correspondent, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: pudsey bear gets a tour of nottingham
text: pudsey bear has been out and about with our presenters in nottingham ahead of bbc children in need on friday .
pudsey bear made his television debut in 1985 when terry wogan introduced the new , brown cuddly mascot to the audience .
in the two decades which have followed , pudsey has received letters , drawings and e-mails from youngsters all over the uk .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: retail firm launches christmas food bank appeal
text: the co-op is launching it 's first ever christmas food bank appeal in the east midlands today .
the firm hopes customers will drop off items like cereal and tinned food to its in-store collection points to help provide meals for those in need .
rob smyth from the co-op said : `` as soon as the campaign finishes , it runs from today until december 20 , it will all be collected by local food bank partners .
`` they will take it to their food banks and create parcels to hand out to people who need it on a weekly basis , so it will probably go right into 2018 helping people for several months . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : emotional animals
text: do n't animals just do the funniest things ?
you 've been capturing some of their `` emotional '' moments across the east midlands .
these alpacas in ripley seem to be having a romantic kiss - although it looks like they 've got an audience .
no quite so loving in ruddington though where this swan got a bit cross .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: delays after tram and car crash
text: a tram and a car crashed in beeston this afternoon .
nottinghamshire police said they were called to the accident in inham road at about 11:50 .
nobody was injured but there are still some delays to the tram service while the car is recovered .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: have you seen missing kyle tuck ?
text: officers are appealing for information after an 18-year-old man went missing .
derbyshire police said kyle tuck was last seen leaving his house in elyn avenue , chesterfield , on friday .
he was wearing a dark grey tracksuit , burgundy waterproof coat and carrying a drawstring bag .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: council pledges more than £ 100k to help the homeless
text: nottingham city council has committed £ 106,000 to help rough sleepers this winter after it found the numbers had gone up .
the authority says there are now 49 people sleeping on the streets compared with 35 last year .
the money , which is part of the cold weather plan , will help fund winter shelter arrangements and wider support .
emmanuel house manages the winter shelter arrangements in partnership with city churches and other agencies .
the money will provide more bed spaces and a nurse-led team to provide healthcare , treatments and advice .
there will also be a homeless prevention service to work with people who have drug and alcohol problems and are `` sofa-surfing '' .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pensioner 's terrified 999 call after armed robbery
text: police have released the 999 call made to them by an elderly woman after she was robbed at knifepoint in her own home .
anthony ormond from parker street in derby was caught on cctv as he went into the 71-year-old 's home stealing her bag with cash inside .
last week the 30-year-old was sentenced to nine years in jail after a jury at birmingham crown court found him guilty of robbery .
this was a very nasty offence against an elderly , vulnerable woman .
mr ormond was caught on cctv in the flat complex but denied the offence , meaning the victim then had to re-live her ordeal in court . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: appeal after man threatened with a knife
text: a man was threatened with a knife by two men demanding his phone and wallet in nottingham .
the 22-year-old managed to run away before anything was taken .
police have now released cctv images of a man they want to speak to in connection with the attempted robbery which happened in north sherwood street on monday at about 22:00 .
both men are believed to have fled the scene in a dark coloured volkswagen , nottinghamshire police said .
officers are linking this to a robbery on thursday when a man was held at knifepoint and dragged to a cash machine in mansfield road .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tram delays in beeston after accident
text: there are further tram delays following an accident on inham road in beeston .
disruption to toton lane trams due to an accident at inham road .
if you require a tram from toton lane or need to get to toton lane there is a short walk needed from inham road .
keep checking website for updates
do n't forget the fault with the tram at shipton street too
yes we have a tram right behind to up our customers .
thanks
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : blind child helped with toys
text: more than 2,000 projects in the east midlands are currently being funded by bbc children in need .
i 've been to visit a family who use one of them - south leicestershire toy library .
they change the lives of children through the use of special toys .
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: nottingham 's ice bar is back and it 's twice the size
text: last-minute festive carving is under way ahead of the official opening of nottingham 's ice bar .
workers are currently piecing together more than 15 tonnes of ice - twice the size of last year 's attraction .
it will be part of the winter wonderland in the old market square which will open on friday .
that 's also when the christmas lights will be switched on at the council house .
this year there 's a narnia-esque feel - it 's been decked out with fairy lights and golden forest branches .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: snooker : selby success in shanghai
text: leicester 's mark selby is through to the last 16 at the shanghai masters .
the world number one survived a fightback from alan mcmanus to clinch the match in a final-frame decider .
selby will face the winner of the match between mark williams and gerard greene .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: jewellery and two gold watches stolen from house
text: jewellery and two gold watches were among some of the items stolen during a burglary in derby .
derbyshire police said it happened at a house in chellaston road at about 12:40 on 8 november .
officers say a man was seen in the area who was wearing a beanie style hat , a black and grey top and blue jeans .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: should sexual harassment be a criminal offence ?
text: the sex scandal spanning hollywood , parliament and beyond has exposed a possible gap in uk legislation - sexual harassment is not actually a criminal offence in its own right .
but in nottinghamshire , the police record misogynistic abuse as as a hate crime .

conservative mp maria miller , who chairs the commons women and equalities committee , said if was taken up by other forces , it would be a straightforward way to record incidents and get an idea of the scale of sexual harassment .
the equality act currently covers sexual harassment in the workplace but outside work , prosecutors must use different pieces of legislation , depending on the nature of the offence .
critics say this leaves us without a proper definition of the types of behaviour that amount to sexual harassment - or clear boundaries .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: religious leader meets thousands of christians
text: about 3,000 people from churches across leicestershire and rutland took over the leicester riders stadium last night to pray with the archbishop of canterbury .
the most rev justin welby is on a three day tour of the city and county - this morning he 's been to see children at billesdon church of england primary school .
the archbishop will be at loughborough university this evening taking questions from non-christians .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man in 'critical condition ' after assault
text: a man has `` life threatening '' injuries after being assaulted in chaddesden .
police found the man on race course park off berwick avenue late last night .
he was taken to hospital in nottingham in a `` critical '' condition .
the area has been cordoned off by police while they investigate .
it 's thought that the man 's attacker was known to him .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: delays after three-car crash
text: officers were called to a crash involving three cars on a busy roundabout in nuthall this morning .
nottinghamshire police said they were called to the a610 at about 08:30 but nobody sustained any injuries .
one lane is blocked but it should be cleared shortly .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tram delays after 'cyclist falls off his bike '
text: there were tram delays for services between hucknall and phoenix park this morning .
tram operator net said a cyclist had come off his bike near nottingham high school and east midlands ambulance service were called to the scene .
services are now running as normal .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man gets 'second chance ' thanks to umbilical cord donor
text: there 's a push to get more women to donate blood from their umbilical cords after giving birth .
the charity anthony nolan said cord blood , like bone marrow , can help patients survive diseases such as leukaemia .
nilush aponso is one of those who had his life saved by an umbilical cord donor in 2013 .
he told the bbc the donation has given him a `` second chance at life '' and more time to spend with his family after he was diagnosed with leukaemia .
lauren sharp from melton decided to donate her cord after giving birth to little sterling six weeks ago .
ms sharp said she signed up to donate after getting an anthony nolan leaflet in a bounty pack given to mums-to-be .
she said it was a `` really easy '' process to organise and she even got a gift to say `` thank you '' for the donation .
at the moment you can only register to donate your cord blood if you 're giving birth in london , manchester or leicester .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your comments : derby walk of fame 'a waste of money '
text: plans to spend £ 70,000 on a walk of fame in derby has n't gone down too well on our facebook page .
matt mcguinness said : `` how about we maintain and clean what we have first and then look at how we support the future ?
be a good way to honour the past . ''
lisa margett said : `` seriously is this something that is really needed when you are cutting back on vital services in the community ? ''
victor dyjas said : `` another waste of tax payers money .
here 's a thought use that money to help the elderly or help with food banks and school transportation . ''
not everyone objects to it though - kalwinder singh dhindsa said : `` this is not a waste of money .
why should we continue to forget to remember our great heroes and heroines ?
we need to remember our great folk . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: 'small conversations ' could prevent railway suicides
text: a campaign has been launched today to encourage people to start `` small conversations '' in an attempt to tackle suicides on nottinghamshire railways .
the samaritans , network rail and british transport police are backing the message that speaking to someone who is acting out of the ordinary could help .
sharon willett was working at newark northgate station when she spotted a young man sitting alone in january 2011 .
she said : `` eventually i managed to sit on the same bench as him but that did spark all his emotions coming out and actually telling me he had come to the station to end his life .
`` just talking and showing him that empathy and keeping calm we managed to get him into a waiting room and call his parents . ''
she was awarded an mbe for her actions and work with the the samaritans .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: investigations continue after firework destroys home
text: police say they are continuing to work with a couple who `` lost everything '' when a stray firework set fire to their home .
wendy and ted bagshaw were watching strictly come dancing when they heard a bang which sounded like a `` exocet missile '' hitting the roof .
the fire service put out the blaze but the house in haven baulk avenue in littleover was severely damaged and many of the couple 's possessions were destroyed .
they said they ca n't move back into their home for at least nine months .
derbyshire police said : `` we are working with mr and mrs bagshaw 's insurance company to determine the category of firework involved , its origins and where it was purchased .
`` we are in regular contact with mr and mrs bagshaw to keep them informed as to how the investigation is progressing and we would ask anyone with information to call us . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: derby to get own walk of fame
text: forget hollywood boulevard - derby is getting it 's own walk of fame .
plaques for `` famous and inspiring people '' will be laid on albion street and exchange street .
they 'll include a feature that allows passers-by access more information about the individual on their phone .
the project will cost £ 70,000 and is being funded by the d2n2 local enterprise partnership .
the first eight people to get a plaque is to be decided by residents of the city .
derby city council is asking for nominations for people either born in derby or with a strong association with derby .
nominees should have made a `` significant contribution '' to the city or achieved `` substantial accomplishments '' in their profession or vocation .
there 's more information about how to nominate a person here .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: how 'chaos ' could create england 's next star
text: how 'chaos ' could create england 's next star
author: Andrew Aloia
BBC Sport

documents.title: slater handed honorary role at notts
text: slater handed honorary role at notts

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather forecast
text: what 's in store for today ?
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: man and woman injured in assault
text: detectives are unsure exactly what happened to a man and a woman injured in an assault outside a house in littleover .
both were taken to hospital , with the man suffering the more serious injuries .
he remains in a stable condition , derbyshire police said .
neither have been well enough to provide an account of what happened at about 16:30 in swarkestone drive yesterday .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : delays across the east midlands
text: travel : delays across the east midlands
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: university makes 'misleading ' claims
text: leicester is one of six universities to find itself in trouble with the advertising standards authority .
the university is accused of making claims that could be misleading in a paid-for facebook post to attract new students .
the authority said the university of leicester must stop claiming to be `` a top 1 % world university '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning nottinghamshire , derbyshire and leicestershire .
amy woodfield and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email , or use facebookor twitter .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live
